intro: Eremostachys baissunensis, commonly known as the Baissun eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in Kazakhstan and Russia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh, dry conditions. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Eremostachys baissunensis is often found in sandy or rocky soils, reflecting its resilience to environmental stress.
